snippet: President Obama’s main counterparts on the world stage make little attempt to cloak their disagreements in diplomatic niceties.
abstract: Pres Barack Obama has two bruising encounters with international leaders in a short span of time, including chilly exchange with Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin; tough meetings underscore hard reality that, as he heads deeper into second term that may come to be dominated by foreign policy, Obama's main counterparts on world stage are not his friends, making little attempt to cloak disagreements in diplomatic niceties.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and PETER BAKER
byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s main counterparts on the world stage make little attempt to cloak their disagreements in diplomatic niceties.

headline.main: Extending a Hand, Obama Finds a Cold Shoulder Abroad
headline.print_headline: Extending a Hand Abroad, Obama Often Finds a Cold Shoulder
